Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of apprehensions at the Southern border, stating that it will be "more than one million people" when the actual number is projected to be around 643,306 for the fiscal year.
Understate: The claim understates the number of apprehensions by not providing the accurate data and instead presenting a higher number.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement of apprehending one million people.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the current rate of apprehensions will continue for the rest of the year, leading to the projected number of one million, which may not be a valid assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the increase in apprehensions, such as changes in border security policies or increased enforcement efforts.
